body.p:
To his excellency Thomas E. Bramlett
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner M. N. Elison respectfully represents to your excellency that at the present term of the Whitley Circuit Court he was fined the sum of twenty Dollars for having acted as bar keeper for himself James Cutberth without being sworn as he states that in consequence of the rebel raids into Whitley County the publick books had not been sent into Whitley County ^as petitioner believes^ and consequently he did not know that there was any law requiring that he should be sworn nor did Mr Cutbirth was enquiriner know it He asks therefore that your excellency interpose your pardoning power and remit said fine he states James Culberth had taken out a license to keep a tavern
M. M. Elison says the statements of the foregoing petition are true
Sworn to before me by M M Elison this 4th day of April 1864

J C Watkins Clk
J L McCarty S. W. C
Gov. Bramlette I believe M M Ellison innocently violated the law as it was not generally known that others then the Tavern keepers themselves were required to take on oath

M. M. Elison
Petition
Whitley Cir Ct
Tipling
$20
